p: Serologic assays are urgently needed for (1) infection prevention measures including identifying the viral sources; (2) epidemiologic and sero-surveillance studies to infer the burden of disease, taking into account the rate of asymptomatic infection and the extent disease transmission to the households; and (3) analyzing the results of vaccine trials and therapeutic antibodies. However, other than few exceptions [ 43], validated serologic assays are relatively lacking at present.
